distributional 0.4.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.1083779 10.0668473
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.8826031 0.8855363
skewness(dist)
#> [1] 0.07661679 0.20792885
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.16066248  0.32642296 -0.02189017 -0.68593246 -0.48339825  0.43606592
#>  [7] -1.09456819 -0.75018278  0.61684228  1.40247432
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1] 10.358462  9.919909 12.585788  9.928571  9.919909  9.255632 11.212281
#>  [8]  8.508810 10.429549  9.582240
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2056339 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))
dimnames(dist) <- c("x", "y")

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#>               x        y
#> [1,] 0.08876462 10.02412
variance(dist)
#>              x         y
#> [1,] 1.1904100 0.1855495
#> [2,] 0.1855495 1.0172643
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>                x         y
#>  [1,] -1.5094697  8.842354
#>  [2,]  0.7548321 10.321186
#>  [3,]  0.9342226 10.372261
#>  [4,] -0.2262390  9.034751
#>  [5,]  0.1753474 10.143075
#>  [6,] -0.9159518  8.656366
#>  [7,] -1.5094697  8.842354
#>  [8,]  1.3307725 11.905774
#>  [9,]  0.1115681  8.983486
#> [10,]  1.6116482 10.333696
#> 
quantile(dist, 0.4) # Returns the marginal quantiles
#>                x        y
#> [1,] -0.04320342 9.817182
cdf(dist, matrix(c(0.3,9), nrow = 1))
#> [1] 0.4
